<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 2+"
    pfs=""
>
[Dragon's Blood Pudding](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1310)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Alchemical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=6" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 46</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>Interact</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

While some unscrupulous chefs claim that this savory pudding is made with real dragon's blood, its crimson color and acrid smell actually come from bloody mandrake paste, ginger root, and distilled terrap sap. This potent combination singes the nostrils and throat, removing effects that make you sluggish. When you consume the pudding, it attempts a [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check with the listed counteract modifier to remove the [slowed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) condition from a single source, using the source of that condition to determine the counteract level and DC.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 2"
pfs="Standard"
>
Dragon's Blood Pudding (Lesser)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 46</row>

**Price** 5 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

The pudding has a +6 counteract modifier.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 5"
pfs="Standard"
>
Dragon's Blood Pudding (Moderate)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 46</row>

**Price** 25 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

The pudding has a +9 counteract modifier. You also become [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=32) for 1 round. While taking the additional action from being quickened, you scream, as a result of both the flavor and the mandrake paste's properties. You can use the additional action to Step, Stride, Strike, or [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=53). If you choose to Demoralize, you gain a +2 item bonus to the [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) check.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 13"
pfs="Standard"
>
Dragon's Blood Pudding (Greater)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 46</row>

**Price** 425 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

The pudding has a +20 counteract modifier. You become quickened as per the 5th-level version, except you gain a +3 item bonus to the Intimidation check.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 19"
pfs="Standard"
>
Dragon's Blood Pudding (Major)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 46</row>

**Price** 5,500 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

The pudding has a +31 counteract modifier. You become quickened as per the 5th-level version, except the effect lasts for 2 rounds and you gain a +4 item bonus to the Intimidation check.
